channel.title: shell on chekos' today i learned
channel.description: Recent content in shell on chekos' today i learned

item.title: jq [] syntax
item.description: what i learned If you want to dump a list of objects you’re constructing from some other json you need to wrap your entire jq string in square brackets ( [] ). Otherwise you’ll be writing each object one at a time and that’s not valid JSON. For example, running something like jq '.[] | {id: .id, title: .title, created: .created } returns → { id: "123", title: "page 1", created: "2022-01-25T23:15:00.

item.title: how to execute a shell script in the current shell
item.description: what i learned when you execute a shell script, it defaults to creating a new shell, executing the script in that shell and closing it. if you want to, for example, set environmental variables you would need to run the script in the current shell. let’s say you want to have a short shell script that sets the database url as an environmental variable called env_vars.sh. #!/bin/bash export DATABASE_URL="super_secret_url" if you run
